awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation:  Zero Droop S/H Circuits for On-Chip   Tuning and Control of Analog Integrated Circuits
awd_abstract_narration: State-of-the-art high-performance analog circuits try to correct                inherent mismatching, inaccuracy, and randomness of analog                      devices by employing signal processing methods known as error                   correction or tuning techniques.  In these techniques, compact                  on-chip zero-droop sample-and-hold (S/H) amplifiers improve                     tuning performance by memorizing tuning information between                     tuning intervals in a stable and accurate way.   A compact and                  stable zero-droop S/H amplifier is being studied and will be                    integrated in a standard CMOS technology.  A systematic study of                this class of algorithms will also be undertaken with the                       purpose of addressing stability, speed, and convergence                         questions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
